articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to President of Council of State of Cuba
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to President of Council of State of Cuba
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, sent a congratulatory message to Miguel Mario Diaz-Canel Bermudez, president of the Council of State of the Republic of Cuba, Friday.
					 In the message Kim Jong Un sent the warmest congratulations to Miguel Mario Diaz-Canel Bermudez upon his election as president of the Council of State of the Republic of Cuba at the 9th Legislative Session of the National Assembly of People's Power of Cuba.
					
					 The message said that his election as the president of the Council of State of Cuba was a manifestation of the firm will of the party and government of Cuba to defend the valuable gains of the revolution, which the Cuban revolutionaries of the first generation gained, and to continuously advance along the road of socialism, and an expression of the trust and expectation of all the Cuban people for him.
					
					 Expressing the firm belief that the fraternal bonds of friendship between the peoples of the two countries provided by the preceding leaders would invariably strengthen and develop in the future, too, the message sincerely wished him register great success in his responsible work in good health.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Italian General Investment Group
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, by the chairman on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Personage
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Italian Personage
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The joint working group delegation led by Vice-Minister of External Economic Relations Ri Kwang Gun left Pyongyang today to take part in the 8th meeting of the joint working group for the implementation of the DPRK-Russia inter-governmental agreement on temporary labor activities to be held in Russia.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russia
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russia
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A Korean book-donating ceremony took place at the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on April 6 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venue of the ceremony were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and the respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Attending the ceremony were personages of the maritime territorial regional committee and the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia in the Far East Region, and other people and officials of the DPRK mission in Vladivostok.
					
					 Dolgachev, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation who doubles as chairman of the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia in the Far East Region, said that he regarded it as the great honor to receive the immortal works of the peerlessly great men of the DPRK on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, the common holiday of mankind. The works will become the good textbooks for the Russian people longing for the DPRK and aspiring after socialism, he added.

articles.title: Foreign Artistes and Delegations Leave
articles.content:
Foreign Artistes and Delegations Leave
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign artistes and delegations left here on Friday after taking part in the 31st April Spring Friendship Art Festival. 
					 They were the Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M. E. Pyatnichki, the Volinaya Stepi Cossack Art Troupe of Russia, Chelyabinsk State Ural Dance Group of Russia, the Lao State Art Troupe, the Classical Ballet Group of the State Music Academy Theatre of Belarus, a Polish soloist, a Cuban clarinet soloist, the Circus of State Acrobatic Company of Russia, the Moscow Bolshoi State Circus of Russia and the Belarusian National Circus. 
					
					 Earlier, leaving here were the Song and Dance Ensemble of the Mongolian Army, the Cyprus musical company, the Flamenco Band of Spain, the string quartette of the Chamber Orchestra Alberic Magnard of France, a soloist of the Japan-Korea Society for Music and Art Interchange, a Bulgarian opera singer, a Portuguese conductor, the jugglery troupe of Thailand, a Singaporean magician, the Chelyabinsk Regional government cultural delegation of Russia, the general manager of the State Acrobatic Company of Russia and his party, the delegation of the China International Culture Dissemination Centre and the delegation of Kaifeng City, China for Cultural Exchange.

articles.title: Delegation of Int'l United Confederation of Koreans Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Int'l United Confederation of Koreans Leaves
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the International United Confederation of Koreans led by First Vice-Chairman Kim Chil Song left Pyongyang Friday.

articles.title: Russia's Juche Idea Study Group Delegation Leaves for Home
articles.content:
Russia's Juche Idea Study Group Delegation Leaves for Home
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Tynda Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea in Russia led by Gennadi Astakhov left here for home on Friday.

articles.title: Iranian Military Attache Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Iranian Military Attache Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Mohammad Hassan Ghaffari Gerdvisheh, military attache of the Iranian embassy here, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Friday on the occasion of the Army Day of Iran.
					 Present there on invitation were Army Lieutenant General Kang Sun Nam, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Seyed Mohsen Emadi and his embassy officials were present there.

articles.title: Piano Solo of Korean Student Held in Indonesia
articles.content:
Piano Solo of Korean Student Held in Indonesia
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The piano solo of Choe Jang Hung, student of Pyongyang Music School No.1 of Kim Won Gyun University of Music was held in Jakarta, Indonesia on April 11 on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the visit to Indonesia by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Jakarta Art Theatre, venue of the piano solo, was crowded with the audience who came to see the rendition of Choe who proved successful at several international piano concours to win the admiration of the world art circle.
					
					 Choe fully displayed his talent.
					
					 He perfectly portrayed Korean and Indonesian songs and world famous songs skillfully with refined rendition to be highly acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued a new stamp (one sheetlet) in commemoration of the 70th anniversary of the Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Public Organizations in North and South Korea in Pyongyang in April 1948 guided by President Kim Il Sung.
					 Seen in the stamp is a Korean painting which depicted the President waving back to the enthusiastically cheering masses at the conference hall, after opening up a brilliant chapter of great national unity by calling on patriotic forces from all walks of life in the north and the south for unity.

articles.title: National Schoolchildren's Festival of Loyalty Closes
articles.content:
National Schoolchildren's Festival of Loyalty Closes
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The 21st National Schoolchildren's Festival of Loyalty closed.
					 The festival which was held, being divided into political, art, sports and economic festivals in the period from the Day of the Shining Star to the Day of the Sun included a contest of youth explainers' agitation among officials of the youth league and youths and students and presentation of experience on reading march to Ryongnam Hill.
					
					 Also included were colorful art and sports activities such as students' traveling agitation troupe contest, schoolchildren art squad contest, Taekwon-do for health contest and volleyball, basketball and table tennis contests of students of senior middle schools.
					
					 Youths across the country briskly conducted mass movement including youth shock brigade activities, socialist emulation movement and youth march of science and technology at difficult and labor-consuming fields of building a powerful socialist country.
					
					 Pyongyang City came first in team standings.
					
					 A closing ceremony took place at the Central Youth Hall Friday.

articles.title: Site of Temple Dating Back to Koryo Period Excavated
articles.content:
Site of Temple Dating Back to Koryo Period Excavated
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The site of Kwangbok Temple, remains in the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392), was newly excavated in Sadong-ri, Phangyo County, Kangwon Province of the DPRK recently.
					 The site is in the valley about 2 km away northeast from Sadong-ri seat. Its area is more than 17,000 square meters.
					
					 The site is divided into the east section and the west section and each section is surrounded by the gallery site.
					
					 In the east section there are sites of gate, tower and Kumdang site which housed main Buddha and lecture site where Buddhism was practiced from the south to the north with the south-north central axis as standard.
					
					 The Kumdang site is 21.1 meters in length and 12.7 meters in the side while the lecture site is 52.4 meters in length and 11.9 meters in the side. Their sites are much larger than the similar sites found in Ryongthong Temple in Kaesong City, a temple known as the biggest one in the period of Koryo Kingdom.
					
					 The western section is divided into the southern part and the northern part with the middle gallery lying in the east-west direction. In the center of each part is a site of buildings.
					
					 The general layout of building is similar to that of Ryongthong Temple just except the position of the central area of the temple.
					
					 Excavated there were various relics including bronze spoon, pieces of Koryo celadon.
					
					 The History Society and the Archeological Society of the DPRK in their joint meeting scientifically proved that Kwangbok Temple was built in around 11th century when Koryo reigned, based on the layout of the building and the relics and historical data found during the excavation.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges U.S. to Keep Pace with International Community
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges U.S. to Keep Pace with International Community
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Soon after the adoption of a resolution denouncing human rights abuses by Israel at the UN Human Rights Council some days ago, the U.S. talked about the necessity to reform the council that has become the "heaven of dictatorial regimes", complaining that the council keeps attacking Israel, the only democratic state in the Mid-east. Meanwhile, the U.S. newspaper The Hill also said that criticism of Israel betrays the serious double-dealing attitude of the UN Human Rights Council.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Friday brands this as a shameless act of confusing the right and wrong.
					
					 Israel's wild act of destroying Mid-east peace and mercilessly killing Palestinians is a hideous crime that deserves denunciations thousands of times, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 If the U.S. is interested in protecting human rights, it should keep pace with the efforts of the international community to denounce and check Israel's human rights abuses.
					
					 But, the U.S. chimed in with Israel in the eyes of the international community, fully disclosing that it is applying double-dealing standards in human rights and politicizing it.
					
					 The U.S. is calling Israel, which is denounced as a human rights abuser by the world, "the most democratic state" in Mid-east and mocking at the international community.
					
					 The reality proves that the primary task for settling the human rights issue is for the international community to heighten vigilance against the U.S. deceptive "human rights" rhetoric and reject it.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges Abe Group Not to Go Reckless
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges Abe Group Not to Go Reckless
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are busy setting up the "general ground force command" in the Ground "Self-Defense Force" for uniform control over the military operations, and organizing "amphibious task force" called "Japan version of marines" and holding the drill of seizing remote islands. They are also stepping up the final assembly of F-35A after introducing parts for 42 fighters from the U.S. munitions company under the plan for deploying 10 F-35A fighters within this year. They put ultra-modern attack submarine Seiryu and mine-sweeper Hirado into commission one after another.
					 A commentary of Minju Joson Friday brands the Japanese reactionaries' spurred moves for realization of overseas militarist expansion as a desperate struggling to attain without fail their dirty political purposes.
					
					 Now the Japanese political camp is like a hornet's nest due to the Abe family's scandal, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The means sought by Abe as a way out of the unfavorable political situation is to intensify the militarist revival. Through the military whirlwind, Abe seeks to overcome the political situation unfavorable for him, distract social censure pointed at him and realize long-term stay in power and the militarist ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are whetting hard the sword for reinvasion, fearing that their militarist ambition for turning Japan into a military giant may end up in failure due to the situation on the Korean peninsula developing toward detente.
					
					 The Abe group should not run amuck, clearly understanding that their frantic militarist revival and reinvasion moves going against the trend of the times are as foolish an act as plunging the lonely island country in the Pacific into the abyss of isolation and destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Forces Accused of Being Harmful to Korean Nation
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Forces Accused of Being Harmful to Korean Nation
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Not only all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad but also the international community are supporting and hailing the inter-Korean summit and the DPRK-U.S. dialogue. But the south Korean conservative group including Hong Jun Phyo, representative of the "Liberal Korea Party," are making reckless remarks that "south Korea is rushing into catastrophe" and the authorities "are staging camouflaged peace farce" day after day. Meanwhile, they are making desperate efforts to check the north-south summit and the DPRK-U.S. dialogue, vociferating about "result of sanctions and pressure" and "strategy for gaining time."
					 Rodong Sinmun on Friday says in an article that the hysterical moves of the south Korean conservative forces are the last-ditch efforts of those who are marginalized by the trend of the era.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The successive south Korean conservative forces have been keen on the racket against the DPRK in league with foreign forces, regarding the north-south confrontation and the escalation of tension on the Korean peninsula as a means of living. They get jitters over the situation developing contrary to what they expected.
					
					 The reckless remarks of the conservative forces taking issue with the above-said summit and dialogue are the abuses of the confrontational maniacs and lunatics to twist the truth, marginalized by the trend of times toward peace and reunification and a revelation of their cynical ploy to scuttle the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group including the "Liberal Korea Party" are nothing helpful to the north-south relations and the Korean nation as they are preoccupied with slinging mud at the compatriots.

articles.title: Gold Prize to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia
articles.content:
Gold Prize to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee of the 15th China Azalea Exhibition awarded the gold prize to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia.
					 The gold prize and diploma were conveyed to an official concerned of the DPRK who participated in an opening ceremony of the exhibition held in Sichuan Province, China on April 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in DR Congo
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Make Our Country Richer and More Powerful, True to the Intention of the Great Leader" was brought out in booklet by the Cedi Publishing House in DR Congo.
					 The work, published on Dec. 31, Juche 83 (1994), indicates the tasks and ways to make our country, our motherland, richer and more powerful.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on April 6.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Successful China Visit Hailed Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Successful China Visit Hailed Abroad
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Organizations of different countries made public statements from April 2 to 10 in congratulation of the successful visit to China by the respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea said that the China visit by Kim Jong Un with the firm will and decision to take over and boost through generations the friendship between the DPRK and China showed the world once again that the fraternal friendship between the peoples of the two countries remains invariable.
					
					 The Central Committee of the All-Russia Lenin Young Communist League stressed that his China visit served as a continuation of the good-neighborly relations between the DPRK and China forged and developed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Romanian Workers' Association said that Kim Jong Un's first visit to China recorded as a significant event in the history of friendship between the DPRK and China was a meaningful one which laid the strong foundation for continuously developing the friendly ties between them.
					
					 The International Friendship Initiative "Explore DPRK" of Poland said that the news of his visit to China caused a worldwide sensation. It was the expression of the ardent reverence of the Chinese people for him that he enjoyed the most cordial hospitality during his visit, the organization added.
					
					 The Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in DR Congo extended sincere congratulations to him for developing the friendship between the DPRK and China onto a new high level through his indefatigable and energetic external activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Miguel Mario Diaz-Canel Bermudez
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Miguel Mario Diaz-Canel Bermudez
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion a Miguel Mario Diaz-Canel Bermudez, Presidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba.
					En su misiva, Kim Jong Un extendio las mas calidas felicitaciones al destinatario por su eleccion como Presidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba en la sesion constitutiva de la IX Legislatura de la Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular.
					
					Senalo que la eleccion de el a ese cargo deviene una muestra de la firme voluntad del partido y gobierno de Cuba de defender de generacion en generacion las valiosas conquistas de la revolucion alcanzadas por los revolucionarios cubanos de la primera generacion y continuar avanzando por el camino del socialismo y una expresion de la confianza y esperanza que le deposita todo el pueblo cubano.
					
					Convencido de que en el futuro tambien se consolidaran y se desarrollaran invariablemente los lazos de amistad fraternal entre los pueblos de ambos paises, preparados por los lideres antecesores, le deseo de todo corazon al destinatario la buena salud y grandes exitos en sus responsabilidades.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe presente de Giancarlo Elia Valori
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe presente de Giancarlo Elia Valori
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio un presente que le dirigiera el presidente del Grupo de Inversion General de Italia, Giancarlo Elia Valori, de visita en Corea.
					El visitante entrego el dia 20 su presente a Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Giancarlo Elia Valori
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Giancarlo Elia Valori
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio el dia 20 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el presidente del Grupo de Inversion General de Italia, Giancarlo Elia Valori, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Delegacion del grupo conjunto de trabajo parte de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Delegacion del grupo conjunto de trabajo parte de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- La delegacion del grupo conjunto de trabajo, encabezada por el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, Ri Kwang Gun, partio hoy de esta capital para participar en la VIII reunion del mismo grupo para el cumplimiento del acuerdo sobre las actividades de trabajo temporal entre los gobiernos de Corea y Rusia que sesionara en el pais europeo.

articles.title: Regresan artistas y delegaciones extranjeras
articles.content:
Regresan artistas y delegaciones extranjeras
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- Partieron el dia 20 de esta capital los artistas y delegaciones extranjeras que tomaron parte en el XXXI Festival Artistico de Amistad Abril en Primavera.
					Entre ellos figuran el Coro Folclorico Academico Nacional M. E. Pyatnichki de Rusia, el Conjunto Artistico Volinaya Stepi Cossack de Rusia, el Grupo Estatal de Danza de Ural de Chelyabinsk de Rusia, el Conjunto Artistico Estatal de Laos, el Grupo de Ballet Clasico del Teatro de la Academia Musical Estatal de Bielorrusia, la comitiva de la solista de Polonia, la comitiva de clarinetista cubano, la Compania Estatal de Circo de Rusia, el Circo Estatal Bolshoi de Moscu de Rusia y el Conjunto Circense Nacional de Bielorrusia.
					
					Anteriormente, se marcharon el Conjunto Artistico del Ejercito de Mongolia, el Conjunto Musical de Chipre, el Flamenco de Espana, el cuarteto de instrumentos de cuerda de la Orquesta de Camara Alberic Magnard de Francia, la comitiva de la solista de la Sociedad Nippo-Coreana del Intercambio de Musica y Arte, la comitiva de cantantes teatrales de Bulgaria, la comitiva del director portugues, el Grupo de Magia de Tailandia, el mago de Singapur, la delegacion cultural del gobierno regional de Chelyabinsk de Rusia, el director general de la compania estatal de circo de Rusia y su comitiva, la delegacion del centro internacional de diseminacion de cultura de China y la delegacion de la ciudad Kaifeng de China para el intercambio cultural.

articles.title: Minju Joson refuta la insistencia de EE.UU. en la "proteccion de derechos humanos"
articles.content:
Minju Joson refuta la insistencia de EE.UU. en la "proteccion de derechos humanos"
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU aprobo una resolucion contra la violacion de derechos humanos por parte de Israel. 
					Al respecto, EE.UU. disparateo que "el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU sigue impugnando solo a Israel, unico pais democratico del Medio Oriente" e insistio en la necesidad de la reforma de esta organizacion internacional calificandola de "eliseo de los Estados tiranicos". 
					
					El periodico estadounidense The Hill tambien chismeo que la critica a Israel resulta un grave acto de doble pauta del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU. 
					
					En un comentario individual de este viernes, el periodico Minju Joson lo califica de proceder cinico que convierte lo negro en lo blanco y continua:
					
					Merece la denuncia el crimen de Israel que destruye la paz del Medio Oriente y asesina despiadadamente a los palestinos. 
					
					Si EE.UU. tuviera algun interes en la defensa de derechos humanos, ha de sumarse a los esfuerzos de la sociedad internacional por rechazar y frenar las atrocidades de lesa humanidad de Israel.
					
					Pero, el imperio norteamericano se muestra partidario de Israel revelando por si mismo que su pais politiza los DDHH y aplica la pauta de doble rasero en este tema. 
					
					EE.UU. describe a Israel, reconocido por todo el mundo como pais criminal de DDHH, como "Estado mas democratico" del Medio Oriente.
					
					La realidad demuestra que la tarea primordial de la sociedad internacional para resolver el problema de DDHH es poner alerta sobre la insistencia enganosa de EE.UU. en la "defensa de DDHH" y rechazarla.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta ultimas medidas militares de la banda de Abe
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta ultimas medidas militares de la banda de Abe
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ACNC) -- En estos dias, los reaccionarios japoneses dan movimientos ajetreados como organizar la "comandancia general de fuerzas terrestres", encargada de la direccion unificada sobre las operaciones militares de las "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa", y librar el "ejercicio de rescate de la isla apartada" movilizando el recien fundado "cuerpo de movilizacion anfibia" llamado como "infanteria de marina de version japonesa". Por otra parte, impulsan el montaje final de F-35A tras importar del complejo de industria belica de EE.UU. las piezas para 42 aviones de ese tipo con el fin de emplazar 10 de ellos dentro del ano en curso y pusieron en servicio uno tras otro el ultramoderno submarino de ataque Seiru y el dragaminas Hirado.
					En un comentario individual divulgado hoy, el periodico Minju Joson califica tales movimientos de expansionismo militarista a ultramar de la desesperacion agonica para alcanzar a toda costa el siniestro objetivo politico, y prosigue:
					
					Ahora, en el circulo politico de Japon se arma un hormigueo debido al escandalo de corrupcion en que esta involucrada la familia de Abe. 
					
					Para salir de la desfavorable situacion politica, Abe trata de levantar la oleada del militarismo. Asi, quiere esquivar las criticas sociales dirigidas a si mismo y realizar su ambicion de la toma perpetua del Poder y la reagresion militarista. 
					
					En particular, los reaccionarios japoneses temen mucho a que fracase su ambicion de convertir el pais en potencia militar debido al cambio de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana hacia la distension.
					
					Ellos deben actuar con prudencia al conocer bien que sus maniobras para el renacimiento de militarismo y la reagresion llevaran el archipielago japones al abismo de aislamiento y ruina.
